RelationshipType.title: Relationship
RelationshipType.definition: The RelationshipType captures relationships between two entities in the MAEC document.

id.description: The id field specifies a unique identifier for the relationship.

source_ref.description: The required source_ref field specifies a reference to the ID of the entity in the MAEC document that corresponds to the source in the (source->target) relationship.

target_ref.description: The required target_ref field specifies a reference to the ID of the entity in the MAEC document that corresponds to the target in the (source->target) relationship.

timestamp.description: The timestamp field specifies a timestamp that states when the relationship was created.

relationship_type.description: The relationship_type field specifies the type of relationship being expressed. The suggested vocabulary for use with this field is relationship-ov.

additional_metadata.description: The additional_metadata field captures any additional metadata that may associated with the Relationship.

supporting_data_refs.description: The supporting_data_refs field references an entity in the MAEC document (e.g., Action or Object) that may support the Relationship.

RelationshipDistanceMetadataType.title: RelationshipDistanceMetadata
RelationshipDistanceMetadataType.description: Captures information associated with a distance metric between the source and target in the relationship.

distance_score.description: The distance_score field captures the distance score between the source and target in the relationship. This is most commonly represented as a floating point value between zero and one (with a higher value representing a greater distance between the two), e.g., "0.62".

algorithm_name.description: The algorithm_name field captures the name of the algorithm used in calculating the distance score specified in the distance_score field.

algorithm_version.description: The algorithm_version field captures the version of the algorithm used in calculating the distance score specified in the distance_score field.
